Lake Havasu City is very far from any major airport. Your best bet would probably be
Lake Havasu City is on Arizona State Route 95, which is accessed via Exit 9 off Interstate 40, about 10 miles east of the California border and 42 miles west of Kingman.

value: , California, on I-40 about 20 miles west of Exit 9, is the closest city with an Amtrak station. It is served by the

Arizona State Route 95 is the city's main (and only) artery.

value: File:London Bridge, Lake Havasu City, Arizona (3227888290).jpg

There are some great sunsets to see in this area in the summer as the sun goes down over the surrounding hills. There are many places to do watersports on the lake with this a popular destination for boating holidays. There is also a golf range near one of the hotels.

value: address=McCulloch Blvd over the Bridgewater Channel Canal

content=Built in 1831 over the River Thames in London (replacing an earlier bridge from the 13th century), the bridge was dismantled in 1967 and shipped in pieces to Lake Havasu City, where it was carefully reconstructed.

There are several restaurants if the London Bridge is crossed onto the island.

value: content=Noted for craft beers including Full Moon, Belgian white ale and the Up River lager. Also serves pizzas and pub food.

There is a Best Western set off the main road in Lake Havasu.  This is on the opposite side of the road to the lake.  It has a swimming pool in the middle court yard and secure boat parking.  There are also several hotels round the London Bridge area of Lake Havasu and some smaller bed and breakfasts.

value: content=Very modern hotel right next to London Bridge with funky rooms with Bridge views. The lively bar (which is also the reception area) with a large outdoor drinking area with Bridge views are clearly audible in rooms, so it's not a hotel for those who want a quiet early night!
directions=on the water and at the base of the London Bridge, 20 minutes from Havasu City Airport
